hackathon-eligibility:
Participants are at least 18 years of age. 
Participants are in teams of no greater than four (4), any person can only be a member of one (1) team and, if participating as part of a team, cannot participate as an individual
The majority of your project must be developed during the Hackathon.
hackathon-requirements: Using years of Boston Marathon, produce the best marathon-related tool. Or, if running's not your jam, honor Boston by creating a more general product or prototype that benefits Boston and its citizens as a whole.
hackathon-rules:
1. Teams may be comprised of up to four individuals; any person can only be a member of one (1) team and, if participating as part of a team, cannot participate as an individual
Once a team has been registered, its members cannot be changed or substituted. 
2. Teams can use any 3rd party open source libraries.
3. Teams may ideate on the concept and begin working on designs ahead of the hackathon start.
4. Teams have (about) 20 hours to develop a working prototype.
5. Teams own their code upon completion of the hackathon.
6. The majority of your project must be developed during the Hackathon.
7. Participants are at least 18 years of age.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: One first place team will earn $2,000.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=222 Third Street, Cambridge, MA 02141, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Does the project solve a real problem in a new or creative way?
Does the project innovate in the area of design, user interaction, or technical solutions?

Is the product easy to use?
Is data presented in a meaningful way?
Is the product beautiful?

Is this project the start of something bigger?
How many people could be affected by the project?
What was the judges’ initial impression / gut reaction to the project?

How much of the project was the team able to complete in the time of the hackathon?
Does the project accomplish its stated goal?
How well was the idea presented?
